articles.title: Take a Bite in Apple Stock Before Earnings?
articles.content: Still trading 18% from its highs, this earnings release could be critical for the momentum of AAPL stock. While other tech stocks have been hit harder during the economic downturn, Apple has shown some resilience with its broader retail and services capabilities.

articles.title: Markets Up Big from a Month Ago, Earnings On Deck
articles.content: The Dow closed +417 points on the day, +1.34%. The blue-chip index is now up +7.65% over the past month.

articles.title: Texas Instruments emerging as favorite after early chip earnings reports evoke sighs of relief
articles.content: Texas Instruments Inc. and KLA Corp. will be tested early in the week ahead of Intel Corp.'s earnings report, as early chip-industry reports have produced beat-and-raise quarters in an environment where many have slashed forecasts.

articles.title: Marqeta to offer banking services as it expands beyond card issuing
articles.content: Marqeta Inc. is expanding into banking products as the company looks to cash in on the wave of businesses planning to add financial-services offerings to their applications.

articles.title: Charting Meta Platforms Stock As This Wall Street Analyst Drops Their Bullish Stance
articles.content:
For the second time in the last last month, Bank Of America has thrown in the towel on mega-cap technology stocks.
Before the opening Monday, BofA downgraded Meta Platforms Inc (NASDAQ: META) from Buy to Neutral and lowered its price target from $195 to $150.
On Sept. 29, BofA downgraded Apple Inc. (NASDAQ: AAPL) from Buy to Neutral and lowered its price target from $185 to $160.
While it took investors a while to “buy the dip” in Apple following the downgrade, they are not waiting around in Monday’s session. The Meta price action makes it the PreMarket Prep Stock of the Day.
Meta's Volatile Week: During Meta's 13-month swoon from an all-time high of $384.33 (September 2021), the issue has seen several temporary rebounds. The most recent emanated from its 69-month low, which was made Oct. 13 at $122.53.
Over the next three sessions, it made a high for the ...Full story available on Benzinga.com

articles.title: How Can I See How Much Tesla Stock Elon Musk Has Sold?
articles.content:
Elon Musk is the largest individual shareholder of Tesla Inc (NASDAQ: TSLA) stock. The company’s CEO has been one of the key investors in the company since the early days and is also important to the future of the company, something he is betting on with his personal money.
Here’s a look at how investors can see when Musk and other executives at Tesla are buying and selling the electric vehicle company shares.
Tesla Insider Trades: Benzinga’s Insider Trades tool shows buying and selling for stocks by executives. The Tesla page shows the sales by Musk in early August, which left him with 155,039,144 shares of Tesla.
After a three-for-one split, Musk now owns 465,117,432 shares of Tesla.
The Insider Trades page also shows that Tesla CFO Zachary Kirkhorn sold company shares in September and October.
Several Tesla executives have also sold options in the second half of 2022. Benzinga previously flagged that there have been no purchases of Tesla common ...

articles.title: This hedge fund manager who made winning bets in 2020, says investors should brace for a decades-long bear market
articles.content: Our call of the day from hedge fund Saba Capital's founder Boaz Weinstein, who warns of a "real headwind" for investors from central bank tightening that could trigger a decades-long bear market

articles.title: Alphabet, Microsoft, Meta Platforms, Apple and Amazon are part of Zacks Earnings Preview
articles.content: Alphabet, Microsoft, Meta Platforms, Apple and Amazon are highlighted at Zacks Earnings Preview article.

articles.title: Wolfspeed (WOLF) to Report Q1 Earnings: What's in the Cards?
articles.content: Wolfspeed's (WOLF) first-quarter fiscal 2023 results are likely to reflect gains from strong demand for silicon carbide substrates.
